member.name: T:Lokad.Cloud.IRuntimeFinalizer
member.summary: Collects objects that absolutely need to be disposed before the runtime gets shut down.
member.remarks:
There is no garanty that registered objects will actually be disposed. When a VM is shutdown, a small grace period (30s) is offered to clean-up resources before the OS itself is aborted. The runtime finalizer should be kept for very critical clean-ups to be performed during the grace period.
Typically, the runtime finalizer is used to abandon in-process queue messages and lease on blobs. Any extra object that you register here is likely to negatively impact more prioritary clean-ups. Use with care.
Implementations must be thread-safe.

member.name: M:Lokad.Cloud.IRuntimeFinalizer.Register(System.IDisposable)
member.summary: Register a object for high priority finalization if runtime is terminating.
member.remarks: The method is idempotent, once an object is registered, registering the object again has no effect.

member.name: M:Lokad.Cloud.IRuntimeFinalizer.Unregister(System.IDisposable)
member.summary: Unregister a object from high priority finalization.
member.remarks: The method is idempotent, once an object is unregistered, unregistering the object again has no effect.

member.name: M:Lokad.Cloud.IRuntimeFinalizer.FinalizeRuntime
member.summary: Finalize high-priority resources hold by the runtime. This method should only be called ONCE upon runtime finalization.

member.name: P:Lokad.Cloud.Storage.Shared.Diagnostics.ExecutionStatistics.Name
member.summary: Gets the name for this counter.

summary.para: Class to provide simple measurement of some method calls. This class has been designed to provide light performance monitoring that could be used for instrumenting methods in production. It does not use any locks and uses design to avoid 90% of concurrency issues.
Counters are designed to be "cheap" and throwaway, so we basically we don't care about the remaining 10%

The usage idea is simple - data is captured from the counters at regular intervals of time (i.e. 5-10 minutes). Counters are reset after that. Data itself is aggregated on the monitoring side. If there are some bad values (i.e. due to some rare race condition between multiple threads and monitoring scan) then the counter data is simply discarded.

member.name: T:Lokad.Cloud.Storage.ITableStorageProvider
member.summary: Abstraction for the Table Storage.
member.remarks: This provider represents a logical abstraction of the Table Storage, not the Table Storage itself. In particular, implementations handle paging and query splitting internally. Also, this provider implicitly relies on serialization to handle generic entities (not constrained by the few datatypes available to the Table Storage).

member.name: M:Lokad.Cloud.Storage.ITableStorageProvider.Insert``1(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Lokad.Cloud.Storage.CloudEntity{``0}})
member.summary: Inserts a collection of new entities into the table storage.

remarks.para: The call is expected to fail on the first encountered already-existing entity. Results are not garanteed if one or several entities already exist.
There is no upper limit on the number of entities provided through the enumeration. The implementations are expected to lazily iterates and to create batch requests as the move forward.
If the table does not exist then it should be created.

member.exception: if an already existing entity has been encountered.

member.name: M:Lokad.Cloud.Storage.ITableStorageProvider.Update``1(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Lokad.Cloud.Storage.CloudEntity{``0}},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Updates a collection of existing entities into the table storage.

remarks.para: The call is expected to fail on the first non-existing entity. Results are not garanteed if one or several entities do not exist already.
If is false, the call is expected to fail if one or several entities have changed in the meantime. If true, the entities are overwritten even if they've been changed remotely in the meantime.
There is no upper limit on the number of entities provided through the enumeration. The implementations are expected to lazily iterates and to create batch requests as the move forward.
Idempotence of the implementation is required.

member.exception: thrown if the table does not exist or an non-existing entity has been encountered.

member.name: M:Lokad.Cloud.Storage.ITableStorageProvider.Upsert``1(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Lokad.Cloud.Storage.CloudEntity{``0}})
member.summary: Updates or insert a collection of existing entities into the table storage.

remarks.para: New entities will be inserted. Existing entities will be updated, even if they have changed remotely in the meantime.
There is no upper limit on the number of entities provided through the enumeration. The implementations are expected to lazily iterates and to create batch requests as the move forward.
If the table does not exist then it should be created.
Idempotence of the implementation is required.

member.name: M:Lokad.Cloud.Storage.ITableStorageProvider.Delete``1(System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Deletes all specified entities.
member.param: The partition key (assumed to be non null).
Lazy enumeration of non null string representing the row keys.

remarks.para: The implementation is expected to lazily iterate through all row keys and send batch deletion request to the underlying storage.
Idempotence of the method is required.
The method should not fail if the table does not exist.

member.name: M:Lokad.Cloud.Storage.ITableStorageProvider.Delete``1(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Lokad.Cloud.Storage.CloudEntity{``0}},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Deletes a collection of entities.

remarks.para: The implementation is expected to lazily iterate through all row keys and send batch deletion request to the underlying storage.
Idempotence of the method is required.
The method should not fail if the table does not exist.
If is false, the call is expected to fail if one or several entities have changed remotely in the meantime. If true, the entities are deleted even if they've been changed remotely in the meantime.

member.name: M:Lokad.Cloud.Storage.IBlobStorageProvider.UpsertBlob``1(System.String,System.String,System.Func{``0},System.Func{``0,``0})
member.summary: Inserts or updates a blob depending on whether it already exists or not.

remarks.para: The provided lambdas can be executed multiple times in case of concurrency-related retrials, so be careful with side-effects (like incrementing a counter in them).

This method is idempotent if and only if the provided lambdas are idempotent and if the object returned by the insert lambda is an invariant to the update lambda (if the second condition is not met, it is idempotent after the first successful call).

member.returns: The value returned by the lambda.

member.name: M:Lokad.Cloud.Storage.IBlobStorageProvider.UpsertBlobOrSkip``1(System.String,System.String,System.Func{Lokad.Cloud.Storage.Maybe{``0}},System.Func{``0,Lokad.Cloud.Storage.Maybe{``0}})
member.summary: Inserts or updates a blob depending on whether it already exists or not. If the insert or update lambdas return empty, the blob will not be changed.

remarks.para: The provided lambdas can be executed multiple times in case of concurrency-related retrials, so be careful with side-effects (like incrementing a counter in them).

This method is idempotent if and only if the provided lambdas are idempotent and if the object returned by the insert lambda is an invariant to the update lambda (if the second condition is not met, it is idempotent after the first successful call).

member.returns: The value returned by the lambda. If empty, then no change was applied.

member.summary: Inserts or updates a blob depending on whether it already exists or not. If the insert or update lambdas return empty, the blob will be deleted (if it exists).

remarks.para: The provided lambdas can be executed multiple times in case of concurrency-related retrials, so be careful with side-effects (like incrementing a counter in them).

This method is idempotent if and only if the provided lambdas are idempotent and if the object returned by the insert lambda is an invariant to the update lambda (if the second condition is not met, it is idempotent after the first successful call).

member.returns: The value returned by the lambda. If empty, then the blob has been deleted.

member.remarks: This provider represents a logical queue, not the actual Queue Storage. In particular, the provider implementation deals with overflowing messages (that is to say messages larger than 8kb) on its own.

member.summary: Updates a blob if it already exists.

remarks.para: The provided lambdas can be executed multiple times in case of concurrency-related retrials, so be careful with side-effects (like incrementing a counter in them).
This method is idempotent if and only if the provided lambdas are idempotent.

member.summary: Updates a blob if it already exists. If the insert or update lambdas return empty, the blob will not be changed.

remarks.para: The provided lambdas can be executed multiple times in case of concurrency-related retrials, so be careful with side-effects (like incrementing a counter in them).
This method is idempotent if and only if the provided lambdas are idempotent.

member.returns: The value returned by the lambda, or empty if the blob did not exist or no change was applied.

member.name: M:Lokad.Cloud.Storage.BlobStorageExtensions.UpdateBlobIfExistOrDelete``1(Lokad.Cloud.Storage.IBlobStorageProvider,Lokad.Cloud.Storage.BlobName{``0},System.Func{``0,Lokad.Cloud.Storage.Maybe{``0}})
member.summary: Updates a blob if it already exists. If the insert or update lambdas return empty, the blob will be deleted.

remarks.para: The provided lambdas can be executed multiple times in case of concurrency-related retrials, so be careful with side-effects (like incrementing a counter in them).
This method is idempotent if and only if the provided lambdas are idempotent.

member.returns: The value returned by the lambda, or empty if the blob did not exist or was deleted.

member.name: M:Lokad.Cloud.Storage.BlobStorageExtensions.UpsertBlob``1(Lokad.Cloud.Storage.IBlobStorageProvider,Lokad.Cloud.Storage.BlobName{``0},System.Func{``0},System.Func{``0,``0})
member.summary: Inserts or updates a blob depending on whether it already exists or not.

remarks.para: The provided lambdas can be executed multiple times in case of concurrency-related retrials, so be careful with side-effects (like incrementing a counter in them).

This method is idempotent if and only if the provided lambdas are idempotent and if the object returned by the insert lambda is an invariant to the update lambda (if the second condition is not met, it is idempotent after the first successful call).

member.returns: The value returned by the lambda.

member.name: M:Lokad.Cloud.Storage.BlobStorageExtensions.UpsertBlobOrSkip``1(Lokad.Cloud.Storage.IBlobStorageProvider,Lokad.Cloud.Storage.BlobName{``0},System.Func{Lokad.Cloud.Storage.Maybe{``0}},System.Func{``0,Lokad.Cloud.Storage.Maybe{``0}})
member.summary: Inserts or updates a blob depending on whether it already exists or not. If the insert or update lambdas return empty, the blob will not be changed.

remarks.para: The provided lambdas can be executed multiple times in case of concurrency-related retrials, so be careful with side-effects (like incrementing a counter in them).

This method is idempotent if and only if the provided lambdas are idempotent and if the object returned by the insert lambda is an invariant to the update lambda (if the second condition is not met, it is idempotent after the first successful call).

member.returns: The value returned by the lambda. If empty, then no change was applied.

member.name: M:Lokad.Cloud.Storage.BlobStorageExtensions.UpsertBlobOrDelete``1(Lokad.Cloud.Storage.IBlobStorageProvider,Lokad.Cloud.Storage.BlobName{``0},System.Func{Lokad.Cloud.Storage.Maybe{``0}},System.Func{``0,Lokad.Cloud.Storage.Maybe{``0}})
member.summary: Inserts or updates a blob depending on whether it already exists or not. If the insert or update lambdas return empty, the blob will be deleted (if it exists).

remarks.para: The provided lambdas can be executed multiple times in case of concurrency-related retrials, so be careful with side-effects (like incrementing a counter in them).

This method is idempotent if and only if the provided lambdas are idempotent and if the object returned by the insert lambda is an invariant to the update lambda (if the second condition is not met, it is idempotent after the first successful call).

member.returns: The value returned by the lambda. If empty, then the blob has been deleted.

member.name: M:Lokad.Cloud.Storage.TableStorageExtensions.Update``1(Lokad.Cloud.Storage.ITableStorageProvider,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Lokad.Cloud.Storage.CloudEntity{``0}})
member.summary: Updates a collection of existing entities into the table storage.

remarks.para: The call is expected to fail on the first non-existing entity. Results are not garanteed if one or several entities do not exist already.
The call is also expected to fail if one or several entities have changed remotely in the meantime. Use the overloaded method with the additional force parameter to change this behavior if needed.
There is no upper limit on the number of entities provided through the enumeration. The implementations are expected to lazily iterates and to create batch requests as the move forward.
Idempotence of the implementation is required.

member.exception: thrown if the table does not exist or an non-existing entity has been encountered.

member.name: M:Lokad.Cloud.Storage.TableStorageExtensions.Delete``1(Lokad.Cloud.Storage.ITableStorageProvider,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Lokad.Cloud.Storage.CloudEntity{``0}})
member.summary: Deletes a collection of entities.

remarks.para: The implementation is expected to lazily iterate through all row keys and send batch deletion request to the underlying storage.
Idempotence of the method is required.
The method should not fail if the table does not exist.
The call is expected to fail if one or several entities have changed remotely in the meantime. Use the overloaded method with the additional force parameter to change this behavior if needed.
